stateCompliance.headline: California Payday Loan Laws for Fontana Residents
stateCompliance.content: Fontana residents in San Bernardino County are protected by California's Deferred Deposit Transaction Law, enforced by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). These regulations ensure lender compliance with strict borrower protections.
keyPoints: Maximum loan: $300 including all fees (typical $255 cash plus $45 fee)
Fee limit: 15% of check amount, maximum $45
One loan only: Can't have multiple payday loans at once
No rollovers: Cannot extend or refinance loans for fees
Criminal prohibition: Cannot threaten criminal prosecution
Single NSF charge: Only one $15 fee per bounced check
Full disclosure: All fees in dollars and APR
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes only. Payday loan laws may change. For current information, contact the DFPI at 1-866-275-2677 or dfpi.ca.gov. For specific legal questions, consult a California attorney. Individual lender terms vary within state law limits.

faq.question: Where is your Fontana location?
faq.answer: We're at 9245 Sierra Avenue, Suite 115, near Fontana Park. Take I-15 Exit 62 toward Sierra Avenue. Easy parking and convenient access.

faq.question: What do I need to bring?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government ID, recent pay stub or bank statements, and your active checking account information. Most residents are approved in about 30 minutes.

faq.question: What's the maximum loan amount in California?
faq.answer: California limits loans to $300 total including fees. You'll typically receive $255 cash with a $45 fee under the 15% fee cap.

faq.question: How quickly can I get approved?
faq.answer: Most Fontana residents are approved and receive cash within 30 minutes at our Sierra Avenue location. We have a quick verification process.

faq.question: Are all fees disclosed upfront?
faq.answer: Yes. California law requires complete disclosure of all fees in both dollars and APR. No hidden charges or surprises.
